Ülikooli 16, ruumid 204, 211, 213
51003 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course is about reading and discussing relevant texts.
description.et: Kursus seisneb erinevate tekstide lugemises ja diskuteerimises.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide an overview of different subdivisions in anthropology.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda ülevaade antropoloogia erinevatest suundadest ja teemadest.

learning_outcomes.en: The student will have an overview of the different subdivisions in anthropology.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilane omab ülevaadet antropoloogia erinevatest valdkondadest.

description.et:
SISSEJUHATUS

MAJANDUSANTROPOLOOGIA


Hann, CM. 1998. 'Introduction: the Embeddedness of Property.', in (eds.) Hann, C. M., Property Relations: Renewing the Anthropological Tradition, pp. 1-47. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.


Woodburn, J.  1998. '"Sharing is Not a Form of Exchange": An Analysis of Property-Sharing in Immediate-Return Hunter-Gatherer Societies', in C. M. Hann (ed.), Property Relations: Renewing the Anthropological Tradition, pp. 48-63. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

JURIIDILINE ANTROPOLOOGIA

Benda-Beckmann, Franz von. 2002 'Who's Afraid of Legal Pluralism?' Journal of Legal Pluralism, 47: 38-82. 

Moore, Sally Falk, 1973 'Law and Social Change: The Semi-Autonomous Social Field as an Appropriate Subject of Study.' Law andf Society Review 7: 719-746.

SUBKULTUURID


Bennett, Andy. 1999. Subcultures or Neo-tribes. Sociology, 33/3.

J.Patrick Williams, 2018. Subculture’s Not Dead! Checking the Pulse of Subculture Studies through a Review of ‘Subcultures, Popular Music and Political Change’ and ‘Youth Cultures and Subcultures. Young, 27(1) 1–17.

RAKENDUSANTROPOLOOGIA

Feit, H.A. The Construction of Algonquian hunting territories.

POSTSOTSIALISM JA POSTKOLONIALISM

Chari, S. and Verdery, K. 2009. Thinking between the Posts: Postcolonialism, Postsocialism, and Ethnography after the Cold War. Comparative Studies in Society and History 2009;51(1):6 – 34.

David Chioni Moore. 2000. Is the Post- in Postcolonial the Post- in Post-Soviet? Toward a Global Postcolonial Critique. PMLA, Vol. 116, No. 1,  pp. 111-128.


Verdery, K. 1996. What Was Socialism and What Comes Next? Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press.


Sneath, D. 1993. Social relations, networks and social organisation in post-socialist rural Mongolia.  Nomadic Peoples, 1993, No. 33, Pastoralism in Mongolia (1993), pp. 193-207

Kudaibergenova, D.T. (2016) The Use and Abuse of Postcolonial Discourses in Post-independent Kazakhstan , Europe-Asia Studies, 68:5.

Brubaker, R. (2011): Nationalizing states revisited: projects and processes of nationalization in post-Soviet states, Ethnic and Racial Studies, 34:11, 1785-1814

LÕPUDISKUSSIOON

IDENTITEET


Evans-Pritchard, The Nuer of Southertn Sudan.



Barth, F.2000. 'Enduring and Emerging Issues in the Analysis of Ethnicity.,' in H. a. Vermeulen and C. Govers (eds.), The Anthropology of Ethnicity. Beyond 'Ethnic Groups and Boundaries', pp. 11-32. Amsterdam: Het Spinhuis.
